title: "It's A Paramount Picture" script on vintage movie poster
content:
Is anyone able to identity the type used for the type "It's A Paramount Picture" and do you know if there is a digital version available?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [great\_moment.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018104759/http:/typophile.com/files/great_moment.jpg) | 80.2 KB |
author: Ty Wilkins

comments.content: Probably hand lettered. But you might like [Mr Dafoe](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018104759/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000077) or [FF Tartine Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018104759/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=12&displayfontid=FF.11326.0.0&fontRendererText=Paramount+Picture+).

Slightly more offbeat, but definitely worthwile -- why not try the excellent [Radio](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018104759/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/mudTyper+Weights/) by [Magnus Rakeng](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018104759/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Magnus%20Rakeng), available in your friendly neighborhood [Village](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018104759/http:/www.vllg.com/).
